chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J Beardsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 191 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be paid to the Crime Compensation Fund and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Comply and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the vicitms, any of their families or residences listed in the criminal complaint.
Sex Offender Treatment.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females under the age of 18 years old.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt:
Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary J Beardsley in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse. 
Victim notification has been complied with.

State presented their recommendations to the court.
Defendant's Mother presented a statement to the court.
Atty. Sonderhouse presented their recommendations to the court.
Defendant presented statements to the court.
  

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  10 Years
Initial Confinement:  4  Years
Extended Supervision:  6 Years
191 Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Comply and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims, their families or residence listed in the criminal complaint.
Sex Offender Treatment.
Comply with the Sex Offender Registry.
Not to have any unsupervised contact with minor females under the age of 18 years old.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $630 (Crime Compensation Fund - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COURT COSTS:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to be transferred to Dodge Correctional - FORTHWITH.
2 statements filed.
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
